summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 31 to November 1, 2019, primarily between attorneys discussing logistical issues regarding defendant Nicholas Tartaglione's access to discovery materials while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The core issue raised by defense attorney Bruce Barket is that his client has been denied regular access to his discovery since October 18.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas 'Nick' Tartaglione. He initiates the email chain to alert prosecutors and prison staff about his client's lack of access to discovery materials since October 18, 2019.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Referred to as 'Nick' and 'Tartaglione'. He is the incarcerated defendant whose access to legal discovery materials is the subject of the email dispute.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the legal representative advocating for Nicholas Tartaglione's access to discovery materials while in custody.

events.title: Discovery Taken from Tartaglione
events.description: The date when Nicholas Tartaglione's discovery materials were reportedly taken from him, after which his attorney claims he was denied access.

events.title: Attorney Raises Access Issue
events.description: Bruce Barket sends emails to prison staff and prosecutors stating there is a problem with his client not being permitted to view his discovery since October 18.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Defense attorney Bruce Barket alleges his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, has been denied access to his legal discovery materials since they were taken from him on October 18, 2019.
The correspondence reveals logistical tensions between defense counsel, prosecutors, and prison staff regarding inmate access to case materials.
The emails are dated October 31 and November 1, 2019, placing this communication after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, and it concerns a separate case involving Tartaglione.
Multiple email addresses and names of other legal personnel (AUSAs, a Supervisory Staff Attorney) are present but are redacted in the provided text.
